summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from July-August 2019 discussing victim notification and management for the Epstein case (31E-MM-108062). It involves coordination between FBI personnel in New York and CID (Criminal Investigative Division) regarding the Victim Notification System (VNS) and cross-referencing victim lists from different investigations.

persons.name: Federal Bureau of Investigation Honors Intern
persons.context: An intern in the New York Division assisting with victim list management for the Epstein case, mentioned in the email signature.

events.title: Victim list coordination for Epstein case
events.description: FBI personnel exchange emails about pulling victim lists from the Victim Notification System (VNS) for case 31E-MM-108062 and coordinating with victim services.

locations: 290 (likely referring to 290 Broadway, FBI New York Field Office or another FBI location)
keyFacts: The FBI was actively managing victim notification for the Epstein case (31E-MM-108062) in July-August 2019 using the Victim Notification System (VNS).
There was coordination between FBI New York Division and CID (Criminal Investigative Division) personnel regarding victim lists and data.
The emails reference a need to cross-check victim lists, possibly between different investigations or jurisdictions (mention of a 'Miami list').
The correspondence shows internal FBI procedural efforts to ensure victims' rights were met and data was accurately recorded in VNS.
All identifiable names in the document are redacted, indicated by placeholders like (NY) (FBI), (CID) (FBI), (DO) (FBI).
